page.title: 06Shakespeare Centre S.on A.
page.content: The Shakespeare Centre was built in 1964 as a world centre of Education to expound the life and works of the playwright William Shakespeare.Money for the project was donated by people and governments all over the world. The Centre houses a library,lecture rooms,historical and costume displays, and,in underground vaults,thousands of documents.These include the register recording the birth and death of Shakespeare and many of his works. There are about 850000 visitors to the Centre and adjacent Birthplace per year and 2m. to the other properties which include Anne Hathaway's Cottage, Mary Arden's House,and Hall's Croft. The Properties are administered by a Trust and a major expense is employing the staff of over 200.These range from maintenance workers to guides and research assistants.
